p: PEBP1 (RKIP), a protease inhibitor, and also a protein related to nucleotide binding [ 73], was found underexpressed after exposure to 17Î±-meT. PEBP1 has been associated with suppression of metastasis [ 73]. Specifically, reduced expression of PEBP1 is highly associated to metastatic cancers, such as prostate metaplasia. Therefore, although a physiological dose of DHT (10 nM) increased PEBP1 expression in prostate epithelial cells [ 74], suggesting androgen anticancer properties, our results suggest that supraphysiological doses of steroids might induce detrimental tumorigenic and degenerative events.
